00041 enum    btRigidBodyFlags
00042 {

00047         BT_ENABLE_GYROSCOPIC_FORCE_EXPLICIT = 2,
00048         BT_ENABLE_GYROSCOPIC_FORCE_IMPLICIT_WORLD=4,

00119         struct  btRigidBodyConstructionInfo
00120         {
00121                 btScalar                        m_mass;
00122 
00125                 btMotionState*          m_motionState;
00126                 btTransform     m_startWorldTransform;
00127 
00128                 btCollisionShape*       m_collisionShape;
00129                 btVector3                       m_localInertia;
00130                 btScalar                        m_linearDamping;
00131                 btScalar                        m_angularDamping;
00132 
00134                 btScalar                        m_friction;
00137                 btScalar                        m_rollingFriction;
00138         btScalar                        m_spinningFriction;//torsional friction around contact normal
00139         
00141                 btScalar                        m_restitution;
00142 
00143                 btScalar                        m_linearSleepingThreshold;
00144                 btScalar                        m_angularSleepingThreshold;
00145 
00146                 //Additional damping can help avoiding lowpass jitter motion, help stability for ragdolls etc.
00147                 //Such damping is undesirable, so once the overall simulation quality of the rigid body dynamics system has improved, this should become obsolete
00148                 bool                            m_additionalDamping;
00149                 btScalar                        m_additionalDampingFactor;
00150                 btScalar                        m_additionalLinearDampingThresholdSqr;
00151                 btScalar                        m_additionalAngularDampingThresholdSqr;
00152                 btScalar                        m_additionalAngularDampingFactor;
00153 
00154                 btRigidBodyConstructionInfo(    btScalar mass, btMotionState* motionState, btCollisionShape* collisionShape, const btVector3& localInertia=btVector3(0,0,0)):
00155                 m_mass(mass),
00156                         m_motionState(motionState),
00157                         m_collisionShape(collisionShape),
00158                         m_localInertia(localInertia),
00159                         m_linearDamping(btScalar(0.)),
00160                         m_angularDamping(btScalar(0.)),
00161                         m_friction(btScalar(0.5)),
00162                         m_rollingFriction(btScalar(0)),
00163             m_spinningFriction(btScalar(0)),
00164                         m_restitution(btScalar(0.)),
00165                         m_linearSleepingThreshold(btScalar(0.8)),
00166                         m_angularSleepingThreshold(btScalar(1.f)),
00167                         m_additionalDamping(false),
00168                         m_additionalDampingFactor(btScalar(0.005)),
00169                         m_additionalLinearDampingThresholdSqr(btScalar(0.01)),
00170                         m_additionalAngularDampingThresholdSqr(btScalar(0.01)),
00171                         m_additionalAngularDampingFactor(btScalar(0.01))
00172                 {
00173                         m_startWorldTransform.setIdentity();
00174                 }
00175         };

00185         virtual ~btRigidBody()
00186         { 
00187                 //No constraints should point to this rigidbody
00188                 //Remove constraints from the dynamics world before you delete the related rigidbodies. 
00189                 btAssert(m_constraintRefs.size()==0); 
00190         }

00307         void    setSleepingThresholds(btScalar linear,btScalar angular)
00308         {
00309                 m_linearSleepingThreshold = linear;
00310                 m_angularSleepingThreshold = angular;
00311         }
00312 
00313         void    applyTorque(const btVector3& torque)
00314         {
00315                 m_totalTorque += torque*m_angularFactor;
00316         }
00317         
00318         void    applyForce(const btVector3& force, const btVector3& rel_pos) 
00319         {
00320                 applyCentralForce(force);
00321                 applyTorque(rel_pos.cross(force*m_linearFactor));
00322         }
00323         
00324         void applyCentralImpulse(const btVector3& impulse)
00325         {
00326                 m_linearVelocity += impulse *m_linearFactor * m_inverseMass;
00327         }
00328         
00329         void applyTorqueImpulse(const btVector3& torque)
00330         {
00331                         m_angularVelocity += m_invInertiaTensorWorld * torque * m_angularFactor;
00332         }
00333         
00334         void applyImpulse(const btVector3& impulse, const btVector3& rel_pos) 
00335         {
00336                 if (m_inverseMass != btScalar(0.))
00337                 {
00338                         applyCentralImpulse(impulse);
00339                         if (m_angularFactor)
00340                         {
00341                                 applyTorqueImpulse(rel_pos.cross(impulse*m_linearFactor));
00342                         }
00343                 }
00344         }
00345 
00346         void clearForces() 
00347         {
00348                 m_totalForce.setValue(btScalar(0.0), btScalar(0.0), btScalar(0.0));
00349                 m_totalTorque.setValue(btScalar(0.0), btScalar(0.0), btScalar(0.0));
00350         }

00382         btVector3 getVelocityInLocalPoint(const btVector3& rel_pos) const
00383         {
00384                 //we also calculate lin/ang velocity for kinematic objects
00385                 return m_linearVelocity + m_angularVelocity.cross(rel_pos);
00386 
00387                 //for kinematic objects, we could also use use:
00388                 //              return  (m_worldTransform(rel_pos) - m_interpolationWorldTransform(rel_pos)) / m_kinematicTimeStep;
00389         }

00392         {
00393                 m_worldTransform.getOrigin() += v;

00402         
00403         SIMD_FORCE_INLINE btScalar computeImpulseDenominator(const btVector3& pos, const btVector3& normal) const
00404         {
00405                 btVector3 r0 = pos - getCenterOfMassPosition();
00406 
00407                 btVector3 c0 = (r0).cross(normal);
00408 
00409                 btVector3 vec = (c0 * getInvInertiaTensorWorld()).cross(r0);
00410 
00411                 return m_inverseMass + normal.dot(vec);
00412 
00413         }
00414 
00415         SIMD_FORCE_INLINE btScalar computeAngularImpulseDenominator(const btVector3& axis) const
00416         {
00417                 btVector3 vec = axis * getInvInertiaTensorWorld();
00418                 return axis.dot(vec);
00419         }
00420 
00421         SIMD_FORCE_INLINE void  updateDeactivation(btScalar timeStep)
00422         {
00423                 if ( (getActivationState() == ISLAND_SLEEPING) || (getActivationState() == DISABLE_DEACTIVATION))
00424                         return;
00425 
00426                 if ((getLinearVelocity().length2() < m_linearSleepingThreshold*m_linearSleepingThreshold) &&
00427                         (getAngularVelocity().length2() < m_angularSleepingThreshold*m_angularSleepingThreshold))
00428                 {
00429                         m_deactivationTime += timeStep;
00430                 } else
00431                 {
00432                         m_deactivationTime=btScalar(0.);
00433                         setActivationState(0);
00434                 }
00435 
00436         }
00437 
00438         SIMD_FORCE_INLINE bool  wantsSleeping()
00439         {
00440 
00441                 if (getActivationState() == DISABLE_DEACTIVATION)
00442                         return false;
00443 
00444                 //disable deactivation
00445                 if (gDisableDeactivation || (gDeactivationTime == btScalar(0.)))
00446                         return false;
00447 
00448                 if ( (getActivationState() == ISLAND_SLEEPING) || (getActivationState() == WANTS_DEACTIVATION))
00449                         return true;
00450 
00451                 if (m_deactivationTime> gDeactivationTime)
00452                 {
00453                         return true;
00454                 }
00455                 return false;
00456         }
00457
